required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Imaging of Peripheral Arteries by Optical Coherence Tomography and Intravascular Ultrasound Imaging
clinical_study.official_title: A Post-market, Multi-vessel Evaluation of the Imaging of Peripheral Arteries for Diagnostic Purposes Comparing Optical Coherence Tomography and Intravascular Ultrasound Imaging

brief_summary.textblock: A non inferiority trial to determine the capability of optical coherence tomography (OCT) imaging to show vessel morphology in comparison to imaging provided by intravascular ultrasound imaging (IVUS).

detailed_description.textblock: Patients requiring diagnostic imaging of peripheral vessels to determine vessel condition and planning treatment strategy will have vessel segments imaged by both OCT and IVUS imaging catheters. The images will be collected into a library and independent readers will rank each image on the quality of vessel morphology and disease.

primary_outcome.measure: Visualization of Vessel Morphology: Layered Structure
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the diagnostic imaging procedures, up to 5 minutes

primary_outcome.measure: Visualization of Vessel Morphology: Non-layered Structure
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the diagnostic imaging procedures, up to 5 minutes
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint was met when OCT imaging had the equivalent or lower mean score than IVUS imaging when comparing non-layered structures. Images were scored on a scale from 1 to 5. A lower score means better image quality and a higher score means worse image quality. Scoring scale for image quality of non-layered structure: 1-Excellent histology-like image quality to 5-unacceptably poor image quality

primary_outcome.time_frame: During the diagnostic imaging procedures, up to 5 minutes
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint was met when OCT imaging had the equivalent or lower mean score than IVUS imaging when comparing images for calcification. Images were scored on a scale from 1 to 5. A lower score means better image quality and a higher score means worse image quality. Scoring Scale for image quality for calcification: 1- Excellent histology-like image quality to 5- Unacceptably poor image quality.

primary_outcome.measure: Visualization of Vessel Morphology: Stent Structure
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the diagnostic imaging procedures, up to 5 minutes
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint was met when OCT imaging had the equivalent or lower mean score than IVUS imaging when comparing stent structure. Images were scored on a scale from 1 to 3. A lower score means better image quality and a higher score means worse image quality. Scoring Scale for image quality of Stent Structure: Excellent image; Acceptable image: Unacceptably poor image.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During the diagnostic imaging procedures, up to 5 minutes
On day of diagnostic imaging procedures, up to 1 hour
primary_outcome.description: Primary safety endpoint is freedom from diagnostic imaging procedure-related and device-associated adverse events.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the diagnostic imaging procedures, up to 5 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Mean diameter measurements include longest and shortest diameter at proximal, middle, and distal locations.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the diagnostic imaging procedures, up to 5 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Total luminal area is measured from the longest diameter at proximal, middle and distal locations.

arm_group.description: A vessel segment will be imaged with intravascular ultrasound (IVUS). The same vessel segment will be imaged with optical coherence tomography (OCT).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult
- suspected vascular disease that might be a candidate for IVUS
- reference vessel can accommodate imaging catheters
- successful diagnostic imaging and removal of IVUS catheter with no adverse events
Exclusion Criteria:
- if female, pregnant or breast-feeding
- unwilling to give informed consent

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: IVUS Imaging vs. OCT Imaging
group.description: A vessel segment will be imaged with intravascular ultrasound (IVUS). The same vessel segment will be imaged with optical coherence tomography (OCT).

baseline.population: 120 matched IVUS and OCT images were collected along defined segments of peripheral vessels from 12 subjects.

group.title: IVUS Imaging vs. OCT Imaging
group.description: A vessel segment will be imaged with intravascular ultrasound (IVUS). The same vessel segment will be imaged with optical coherence tomography (OCT).

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Mean length of target segment of vessel
Number of images containing a specific vessel characteristic to be scored

outcome.title: Visualization of Vessel Morphology: Layered Structure
outcome.time_frame: During the diagnostic imaging procedures, up to 5 minutes
outcome.population: Twenty-four imaging pairs of the 120 imaging pairs (240 images total) were analyzed for layered structures.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
